meanings.definition: Difficult to find, catch, or achieve.
meanings.sent1: The elusive butterfly fluttered away before I could catch it.
meanings.sent2: The treasure was elusive, hidden deep within the cave.
meanings.sent3: The elusive answer to the riddle kept slipping from my grasp.
meanings.sent4: Her elusive smile hinted at a secret she refused to share.
meanings.sent5: The elusive dream of becoming a famous singer motivated her every day.

meanings.definition: Tending to evade grasp or pursuit.
meanings.sent1: The elusive thief vanished into the night, leaving no trace behind.
meanings.sent2: The elusive fox darted through the forest, avoiding capture.
meanings.sent3: The elusive cat toyed with the string, always managing to escape.
meanings.sent4: His elusive charm made him irresistible to everyone he met.
meanings.sent5: The elusive shadow seemed to dance just out of reach, teasing the onlookers.

meanings.sent1: The elusive concept of time travel baffled even the brightest scientists.
meanings.sent2: The elusive meaning of the ancient text remained a mystery to scholars.
meanings.sent3: The elusive theory left the students scratching their heads in confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her elusive personality was a puzzle that no one could solve.
meanings.sent5: The elusive truth seemed to shift and change with each passing moment.
